bridge_ref.description: RIS_ID of the Bridge object the Bridge Opening is belonging to.

cl_height_cm.description: Available height in cm based on the reference height (vertical clearance datum) of the bridge.

cl_height_open_cm.description: Available height in cm of the operable bridge in opened condition, based on the reference height (vertical clearance datum) of the bridge. Don't fill this parameter in case of a fixed bridge. In case of unlimited height for an operable bridge fill in null.

abs_height_cm.description: Absolute height of the bridge based upon the used reference level for heights.

abs_height_open_cm.description: Absolute height of the open bridge (if applicable) based upon the used reference level for heights.

max_height_cm.description: Maximum allowed height of the vessel in cm. This shall be a fall-back default value for all ship categories, if no Sailing Dimensions table is provided. Normally this is cl_height_cm minus safety_margin. Null -> no height restriction.

max_height_open_cm.description: Maximum allowed height of the vessel in cm, if the bridge is operable and opened. This shall be a fall-back default value for all ship categories, if no Sailing Dimensions table is provided. Don't fill this parameter in case of a fixed bridge. Null -> no height restriction.

cl_width_cm.description: Available width in cm of (the fairway in) the Bridge Opening.

max_width_cm.description: Maximum allowed width of the vessel in cm. This shall be a fall-back default value for all ship categories, if no Sailing Dimensions table is provided.

pass_duration_minute.description: Average passage duration in minutes, if the bridge is operable. ETD = ETA + pass_duration_minute.

bridge_type.description: This attribute indicates the type of the bridge opening.

operable.description: This attribute indicates, if the bridge opening can be operated in a way that it may be lifted to allow the passage of vessels that otherwise would exceed the clearance height (generally true for Lift Bridge and Drawbridge).

operation_type.description: This attribute indicates how the bridge is operated, if it is an operable bridge. Allowed values: 0 (Local Operation), 1 (Remote Operation), 2 (Self-Service), 3 (Automatic), 4 (not applicable), null (unknown)

direction.description: This attribute indicates, if the bridge opening can only be passed by vessels coming from a certain direction. Allowed values: UPS (upstream), DWN (downstream), ALL (all directions)

position.description: The Position of the bridge opening. Allowed values: LE (Left), MI (Middle), RI (Right), LB (Left bank), RB (Right bank).
